alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 23 at 11:08AM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Republic affecting Marquette County. Michigamme River near Crystal Falls (Michigamme) affecting Iron County. .Runoff from recent rain and snow melt will continue to cause high river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt continue. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Republic. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.7 feet, Water begins to impact the yards of homes near Bengtson bridge on County Road LI in South Republic * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:47 AM EDT Saturday, April 22 the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:47 AM EDT Saturday was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 8.4 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Monday afternoon at 200 PM EDT /100 PM CDT/.
